headline.print_headline: Afghanistan Executes Six In Gesture On Taliban
headline.seo: Execution of Taliban Prisoners Draws Mixed Reaction in Afghanistan
headline.main: Afghanistan Executes Six in Gesture on Taliban

docs.snippet: The attack, deep in the main diplomatic neighborhood of Kabul, killed three security guards and wounded two civilians, according to police officials....
docs.abstract: Afghan government hangs six Taliban prisoners days after welcoming Pakistan's release of other Taliban prisoners; executions illustrate tightrope that Pres Hamid Karzai must walk in reaching out to Taliban politically while demonstrating his opposition to their terrorist acts.

byline.contributor: Sharifullah Sahak, Jawad Sukhanyar and Taimoor Shah contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: The attack, deep in the main diplomatic neighborhood of Kabul, killed three security guards and wounded two civilians, according to police officials.

headline.print_headline: Appreciating The Art Of a Deal
headline.seo: At MoMA, Garage Sale as Performance Art
headline.main: Appreciating the Art of a Deal

docs.snippet: A performance piece priced to move: MoMA’s Meta-Monumental Garage Sale....
docs.abstract: Meta-Monumental Garage Sale, at Museum of Modern Art, is both tag sale and latest iteration of performance piece that artist Martha Rosler has been enacting for four decades, selling items donated by friends, family and fans, as well as her own castoffs.
docs.lead_paragraph: A performance piece priced to move: MoMA’s Meta-Monumental Garage Sale.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  MENZI, DONALD W.

docs.snippet: MENZI-Donald Wilder. Slipped away peacefully at his Greenwich Village home on the morning of Wednesday, November 21st, just shy of his 75th birthday. Born in Ypsilanti, MI,  Donald traversed the land between his family of Congregational missionari...
docs.lead_paragraph: MENZI-Donald Wilder. Slipped away peacefully at his Greenwich Village home on the morning of Wednesday, November 21st, just shy of his 75th birthday. Born in Ypsilanti, MI, Donald traversed the land between his family of Congregational missionaries in China, the Episcopalian priesthood and, finally, Reconstructionist Judaism in his adopted and beloved New York City. He attended Oberlin College, Bexley Hall Seminary when it was at Kenyon, Hebrew Union College and New York University for his Ph.D. His life was a blend of religion, Kabbala, music, education and what makes cities work. Since retiring from the Research Foundation at CUNY where his lifelong fascination with work-force development and education was given free rein, he has devoted himself to editing his ancestors' China papers in juxtaposition with contemporaneous New York Times reportage going back to the 1860s through the 1940s. The archive is expected to appear online at the Yale School of Divinity. Predeceased by his last wife, Matlea Fagin, he is survived by his wife of 13 years Jane Weprin-Menzi, and sons Mark (Sandy), Aaron (Aara), Richard (Naomi Luppescu), and daughter Rachel (Roberto Alvelaiz) and granddaugters Rachel, Gabriella and Teresa and grandsons Valdis, Liez and William. Also surviving him are his Weprin stepsons, Michael (Anne), Andrew (Tasha Fogelman) and Adam (Ludmila Silva) and stepdaughter Julia (Ryan Suda) as well stepgrandsons Connor, Cooper and Jack and stepgranddaughters Ariela (Ryan Wolff), Samira and Lily. All of the above, along with so many others, will miss this menschlichkeit man forever. Funeral services will be held on Friday morning at 11am at his synagogue, The West End Synagogue, 190 Amsterdam Ave., at the Southwest corner of 69th St., to which donations may be made if one should happen to desire.

docs.snippet: KLEIN--Florence (Strasser), 79, of West Windsor, NJ, passed away on November 20, 2012, surrounded by her children and grandchildren. Beloved companion of the recently deceased Joe Hazen, and widow of Lenny Klein, and Artie Strasser, she is survive...
docs.lead_paragraph: KLEIN--Florence (Strasser), 79, of West Windsor, NJ, passed away on November 20, 2012, surrounded by her children and grandchildren. Beloved companion of the recently deceased Joe Hazen, and widow of Lenny Klein, and Artie Strasser, she is survived by her children and their spouses, her grandchildren and great grandchildren, and Joe's children. In accordance with Flo's wishes there will be a graveside service for immediate family on Friday, November 23rd at 11am at Beth El Cemetery, 80-12 Cypress Hills St., Ridgewood, NY 11385. The family will be sitting shiva on Friday, immediately following the services, at Robby and Janie's home and on Saturday, after sundown, at Michael and Debbie's home. Donations in Florence's memory can be sent to Temple Shaari Emeth, 400 Craig Road, Manalapan, NJ 07726, Rabbi's discretionary fund. Donations will be used to help victims of Hurricane Sandy.

docs.snippet: MENZI--Donald Wilder. Renaissance man, visionary, scholar, mensch, Don Menzi was all of these and so much more. The community of West End Synagogue will long mourn the loss of this remarkable man, our former president. We extend our deepest condol...
docs.lead_paragraph: MENZI--Donald Wilder. Renaissance man, visionary, scholar, mensch, Don Menzi was all of these and so much more. The community of West End Synagogue will long mourn the loss of this remarkable man, our former president. We extend our deepest condolences to his dearest Jane; to his children, Mark (Sandy), Rachel (Roberto), Aaron (Aara) and Richard (Naomi); to his "steps" - Julie (Ryan), Michael (Anne), Andrew (Tasha) and Adam (Ludmila); to his grandchildren, extended family and his many circles of friends and admirers. Don modeled a life lived fully and with enthusiasm, from his studies of Kabbalah to his extraordinary and ongoing efforts towards the betterment of our congregation, transcribing his grandparents' China journals, the Psalms Project he and Jane initiated, taking his grandson Val to piano lessons or tracking down the five rabbis of the Haggadah. He enriched our lives, expanded our intellects, and touched our souls. We will miss him terribly. West End Synagogue Rabbi Marc Margolius Hazzan Ayelet Piatigorsky Jerry Saltzman, President

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  RUDMAN, WARREN B.

docs.snippet: RUDMAN--Warren B. The partners, counsel, associates and staff of the firm of Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison LLP express profound sorrow at the death of our former partner, current Of Counsel, friend and colleague, Warren B. Rudman. We ex...
docs.lead_paragraph: RUDMAN--Warren B. The partners, counsel, associates and staff of the firm of Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison LLP express profound sorrow at the death of our former partner, current Of Counsel, friend and colleague, Warren B. Rudman. We express our deepest sympathies to all members of the family.

docs.snippet: TABAK--Harriet. The Trustees and Staff of the Museum of Jewish Heritage - A Living Memorial to the Holocaust mourn the passing of Harriet Tabak, beloved mother of Trustee Jeffrey Tabak. We extend our deepest sympathies to Jeff and his family. Robe...
docs.lead_paragraph: TABAK--Harriet. The Trustees and Staff of the Museum of Jewish Heritage - A Living Memorial to the Holocaust mourn the passing of Harriet Tabak, beloved mother of Trustee Jeffrey Tabak. We extend our deepest sympathies to Jeff and his family. Robert M. Morgenthau, Chair David G. Marwell, Director
